pr_title: [CheckRuns] Add method for listing checkruns for given ref

timeline.message: [CheckRuns] Add method for listing checkruns for given ref

timeline.bodyText: Suggested change * the io exception * the io exception * @see List check runs for a specific ref
timeline.author: bitwiseman
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1773,6 +1773,24 @@ public GHCommitStatus getLastCommitStatus(String sha1) throws IOException {
         return v.isEmpty() ? null : v.get(0);
     }
 
+    /**
+     * Gets check runs for given ref.
+     *

timeline.message: [CheckRuns] Add method for listing checkruns for given ref
[CheckRuns] Add method for listing checkruns for given ref

timeline.bodyText:
I think you'll need to model this after the PagedSearchIterable.  The check runs use paged responses: https://developer.github.com/v3/checks/runs/#response-3
You'll also need to have a test that returns multiple pages (you can force this by having a paged iterable with a small pageCount.
timeline.author: bitwiseman

replies.bodyText:
FYI, I don't love the behavior of PageSearchIterable currently. The Iterable has methods that I would rather see done elsewhere.
This method relies on a cached result, meaning the Iterable can get out of sync with underlying search results. 😭
https://github.com/github-api/github-api/blob/bccae94c7a740fa7ba297fd6eb2a6782ed156a98/src/main/java/org/kohsuke/github/PagedSearchIterable.java#L48-L50
Opened #749 for this.
replies.author: bitwiseman

replies.bodyText: Thanks, I didn't spot that :-) Is it OK to create a search builder class - with one method specifying the ref and not extending GHSearchBuilder - so that it's similar to other search builders even though it's not using the search api? Or should I not mix it with search other builders? Or any other idea? :-)
replies.author: avano

replies.bodyText:
I don't have any strong requirement here except that the api properly support paging.
No, it shouldn't extend search builder, just use a the same basic structure with an adapt() method to create an iterator that works.
Probably want to make GHCheckRuns into GHCheckRunsPage and make it internal.
And then have a CheckRunsIterable also internal that extends PagedIterable<GHCheckRun>.   Finally, have getCheckRuns(String ref) return PagedIterable<GHCheckRun>.
The reason I suggest doing it this way, is to limit added API surface area. While your underlying implementation will be different, users will interact with it as a normal PagedIterable.
replies.author: bitwiseman

replies.bodyText: I created a temp commit here avano@6ba7b3d - can you please check if I understood correctly?
replies.author: avano

replies.bodyText: @avano Yes, that looks right to me.
replies.author: bitwiseman

timeline.bodyText: Once you have GHCheckRuns using paging you can set page count to 1 and rerecord this.  Also, you could record this based on github-api/github-api which currently has a larger number of checks.
timeline.author: bitwiseman

timeline.bodyText: This method has bad performance.  Opened #748.  Thanks!
